title: SO2 and O2 rxn - bond energy

content.description:
An equimolar mixture of <math alttext="S O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a rigid container at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The initial pressure in the container is <math alttext="0.20 atmosphere" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A catalyst is added to the mixture, and the reaction represented below occurs.

<math alttext="2 S O 2 gas plus O 2 gas, react to produce 2 S O 3 gas. delta H naught, equals negative 200 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>200</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question:
Bond Type
 Bond Energy (<math alttext="in kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)

Sulfur-oxygen bond in <math alttext="S O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="530" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>530</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Oxygen-oxygen bond in <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Sulfur-oxygen bond in <math alttext="S O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="question mark" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mo>?</mo> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaGG=aaaaa@39C1@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

Based on the bond energies given in the table and the value of <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is the best estimate for the energy of one of the sulfur-oxygen bonds in <math alttext="S O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="403 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>403</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="470 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>470</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="880 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>880</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="1410 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1410</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="470 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>470</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
